incident.close_notes:
Issue: Unable to access CST system, Error: Unable to load this page.
Support team : We have provided the below workaround to user Clear Your Browser Data. 1.1 Clear the cache then tap on Preferences > Privacy, then choose Remove All Website Data. 1.2 Safari > History > Clear History 2. Check Your Device's Date and Time: Navigate to System Preferences > Date & Time and confirm that you're using the right date and time.
3. Disable Your Browser Extensions: Navigate to Preferences and click on the Extensions tab and Disable.
We suggested multiple resolution steps to resolve the issue since we thought it is a browser issue after following steps also issue is not solved and no other user reported the issue . we Believe it is a network issue please reach out to local network admins team to resolve the issue.
As per the user cnfirmation we are closing the issue.

sys_journal_field.name: incident
sys_journal_field.value:
Waiting for user confirmation, we have provided the workaround on this issue. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From: Choudhary, Swati [GTSUS Non-J&J] <SChoud39@its.jnj.com> Sent: Friday, September 8, 2023 12:12 AM To: Wu, Peng [MEDCN] <PWu43@ITS.JNJ.com> Cc: ECM IT Application Support Team <DL-JOICA-ECMIT-ApplSupTeam@ITS.JNJ.com> Subject: RE: ECM_PROD# INC000027974750
Hi Peng,
Thanks for sharing the error details with us. We have checked and found that all these errors pertain to Browser issues.
W.r.t Safari browser error, we have found this to be a known issue where Safari sometimes blocks users from accessing a website that it believes isn't secure. When this happens, the error message displayed will typically state "Safari Cannot Open the Page Cannot Establish a Secure Connection." Could you please try below steps as a workaround and confirm if this resolves the error?
1. Clear Your Browser Data. 1.1 Clear the cache then tap on Preferences > Privacy, then choose Remove All Website Data. 1.2 Safari > History > Clear History 2. Check Your Device's Date and Time: Navigate to System Preferences > Date & Time and confirm that you're using the right date and time.
3. Disable Your Browser Extensions: Navigate to Preferences and click on the Extensions tab and Disable.
-- Thanks & Regards, Swati Choudhary Cognizant Technology Solutions Application Support / ITAS Manyatha Tech Park, 4th Floor ▪ Bangalore ▪ India

incident.close_notes: Issue: I've encountered an error message while attempting to submit a supplemental report -MWR-14082023-0001461294 (PC-001401911) in ECM. The report failed due to this error message "Error: Duplicate report is found for this supplement report" Would you be so kind as to provide assistance? Thanks Cause: Report is Passed with different Core id in FDA due to this MWR got Duplicate Report Error. Resolution: MedWatch reports # MWR-14082023-0001461294 has been Passed with different Core Id at FDA end. Due to this it returned as 'Data Error' in ECM. Document the details in complaint and manually move the Report Status to 'Complete' and Submission Status to 'Passed' Closure: As we don't have any dependency, hence we are closing the ticket.

We provided analysis and workaround for the MedWatch issue, hence we are closing ticket. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From: Bheema, Rajesh [GTSSG NON-J&J] <RBheema@ITS.JNJ.com> Sent: Wednesday, August 23, 2023 9:17 AM To: Anane, Afra [SYNNA] <aanane1@ITS.JNJ.COM>; ECM IT Application Support Team <DL-JOICA-ECMIT-ApplSupTeam@ITS.JNJ.com>; ECM - Communications <ECMComms@its.jnj.com> Subject: Re: INC000027892603: Your issue was submitted successfully PC-001401911- Requesting update
Hello Arna,
In the email below, we have shared the analysis and workaround for the MedWatch issue. There is no pending action from ECM's end. Hence, we are closing the incident. Kindly let us know if you have any concerns, and we will assist you further.
Best Regards, Rajesh Bheema. From: Anane, Afra [SYNNA] <aanane1@ITS.JNJ.COM> Sent: Tuesday, August 22, 2023 5:28 PM To: Bheema, Rajesh [GTSSG NON-J&J] <RBheema@ITS.JNJ.com>; ECM IT Application Support Team <DL-JOICA-ECMIT-ApplSupTeam@ITS.JNJ.com>; ECM - Communications <ECMComms@its.jnj.com> Subject: RE: INC000027892603: Your issue was submitted successfully PC-001401911- Requesting update

From: Bheema, Rajesh [GTSSG NON-J&J] <RBheema@ITS.JNJ.com> Sent: Tuesday, August 22, 2023 6:46 AM To: Anane, Afra [SYNNA] <aanane1@ITS.JNJ.COM>; ECM IT Application Support Team <DL-JOICA-ECMIT-ApplSupTeam@ITS.JNJ.com>; ECM - Communications <ECMComms@its.jnj.com> Subject: Re: INC000027892603: Your issue was submitted successfully PC-001401911- Requesting update
Hello Afra,
Ticket Description :
I've encountered an error message while attempting to submit a supplemental report -MWR-14082023-0001461294 (PC-001401911) in ECM. The report failed due to this error message "Error: Duplicate report is found for this supplement report" Would you be so kind as to provide assistance? Thanks
Support Team Comments :
MedWatch reports # MWR-14082023-0001461294 has been Passed with different Core Id at FDA end. Due to this it returned as 'Data Error' in ECM. Document the details in complaint and manually move the Report Status to 'Complete' and Submission Status to 'Passed'. Attached is the Passed ACK3 file for your reference.
Please let us know if you have any concerns.
Best Regards,
Rajesh Bheema
Cognizant Technology Solutions
Application Support / ITAS
From: Anane, Afra [SYNNA] <aanane1@ITS.JNJ.COM> Sent: Monday, August 21, 2023 10:23 PM To: Bheema, Rajesh [GTSSG NON-J&J] <RBheema@ITS.JNJ.com>; ECM IT Application Support Team <DL-JOICA-ECMIT-ApplSupTeam@ITS.JNJ.com>; ECM - Communications <ECMComms@its.jnj.com> Subject: RE: INC000027892603: Your issue was submitted successfully PC-001401911- Requesting update
FYI,
We just received an e-mail with a list of all the affected MWs with the ACK issue.
PC-001401911 is not on the list because it is an isolated incident.
